description:
No abstraction shall take place unless the Licence Holder has completed the borehole headworks such that:

(i) The borehole is located in a suitable building or in a vented chamber with safe access for measuring the water level in the borehole and reading the meter.

(ii) The borehole is sealed with a capping plate to prevent the ingress of potentially contaminating materials or substances.

(iii) Where the borehole is installed in a chamber, the chamber shall be provided with a system of drainage to prevent the accumulation of standing water in the chamber.

(iv) A dip tube, with removable cap, shall be installed in the borehole so that a cable dipper can be lowered to record the lowest water level without fouling any installed equipment.
